paragraphs.text: I went to a new year’s event at a free spirit church where they have you write out how you want to feel at the end of 2017. What you want to have accomplished….social skills you’ve mastered….how do I want to FEEL about myself at the end of 2017? That letter to ourselves was put in sealed envelopes and addressed to us. The church will mail them all…

81208d5855fd.title: It’s sad to see that in this day and age the word “science” has become “religious.”

content.subtitle: Like I said, science has pretty much become the new religion for the iAnything generation. :grin:

virtuals.subtitle: Like I said, science has pretty much become the new religion for the iAnything generation. :grin:

paragraphs.text: It’s sad to see that in this day and age the word “science” has become “religious.” Eg. Anything and everything that’s scientific is supposed to be authoritative when in fact it’s just an observation (many times biased by financial gain) made by a small group of so-called experts.

paragraphs.text: Like I said, science has pretty much become the new religion for the iAnything generation. :grin:

54095e86f745.title: I think self motivation comes from internal “pain” first and foremost.

paragraphs.text: I think self motivation comes from internal “pain” first and foremost. Human seeks to avoid pain and gain pleasure. No pain no gain. No pain no motivation. The rest is all fluff.

9580a4799146.title: Yesterday, without meaning to, I did not go back to work after having lunch with my brother.

paragraphs.text: Yesterday, without meaning to, I did not go back to work after having lunch with my brother. When the day ended (and this is after a long string of workworkwork/eat/sleep/work/workwhileeating/dreamofworking), I felt reborn — once I kicked out of my mind like a football the “old brain” screaming, “WHAT DID YOU DO TODAY? ARE YOU CRAZY?” Thanks for this…right on time!
paragraphs.name: b615

paragraphs.text: This really helps. Once you zoom out and see the fun part of whatever you are procrastinating, it will become a much pleasurable experience.

6990fcae14d8.title: I totally agree with all you wrote in your article!

paragraphs.text: I totally agree with all you wrote in your article! Thank you so much for sharing the information. I would love to share one of my articles about “6 Simple Tips To Improve Your Lifestyle” and probably you could incorporate them to you life and could help you to motivate yourself.

This stuff really works. I feel like I go through cycles where I really focus on visualizing and then I fall off the wagon. It’s insane to see the difference between the two, either things/opportunities/awesome happening (when I’m visualizing)consistently all the time or more sporadic (when I procrastinate/forgot to keep my habit going).

9a490506b33e2fcb511b07d4e5d6ffaf.title: The Secret To Your Self-Motivation Lies In This Surprising Science-Backed Habit

paragraphs.text: So when the time comes for us to create and be productive, instead of focusing on the pleasurable and rewarding aspects of obtaining our goals, our brains dwell on the anxiety and fear that comes along with doing something new or putting ourselves out there, or daring to fail.
paragraphs.name: 7d54

paragraphs.text: Siegel suggests one simple way to snap out of a self-motivation rut is to write out a list and get the joys of doing something to outweigh the initial pangs of getting started.
paragraphs.name: b1d2

paragraphs.text: The Secret To Your Self-Motivation Lies In This Surprising Science-Backed Habit
paragraphs.name: ed78

paragraphs.text: As you write out your list, really try to visualize and conjure up the precise feelings and sensations that meeting your goal will bring you.
Mentally walking yourself through the process of success and the joys and benefits it brings can teach your brain to be motivated by something other than fear.
paragraphs.name: 2f11

paragraphs.text: We can do anything we set our minds to. But sometimes it can feel like our brains are working against us when it comes to achieving our goals.
paragraphs.name: 5c1b
